alert.note: Alert for San Mateo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 13 at 1:26PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following area, San Mateo. * WHEN...Until 430 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 125 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in Half Moon Bay. - Half Moon Bay is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Daly City, South San Francisco, San Bruno, Pacifica, Burlingame, Half Moon Bay, Hillsborough, Highlands-Baywood Park, El Granada, Moss Beach and Montara. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
